results.title: Our living past
results.creator_credit: Peter Thompson, Andrew J. Helgeson and Austral Pacific Productions
results.brief_description: Deals with Australia’s heritage of historic places and buildings existing today, to be used and enjoyed by all. Describes Macquarie’s Old Government House, Sydney, The Rocks, Sydney; Royal Theatre, Hobart; Port Arthur, Tasmania; Windsor Hotel, Melbourne; the Lunatic Asylum, Perth; and many other places throughout Australia Photographed by Peter Leyden and Hans Heidrich. Sound by Kevin McLellan. Commentator, Tim Elliot.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Thompson, Andrew J. Helgeson and Austral Pacific Productions

results.title: Our land needs your help
results.creator_credit: Arthur Barr and Arthur Barr Productions
results.brief_description: Made to develop an awareness of our environmental problems. Follows a group of young people as they clean a polluted stream, check erosion, plant trees, and collect materials for recycling. Uses a blend of original songs, narration and natural sound.
results.description: Made to develop an awareness of our environmental problems. Follows a group of young people as they clean a polluted stream, check erosion, plant trees, and collect materials for recycling. Uses a blend of original songs, narration and natural sound.

results.title: Our inheritance from the past
results.brief_description: Explains, for American school children, how certain features of modern life have been inherited from the past. Instances the farm cultivator which developed from the ancient plough; the highway and its origin in Roman road-making; the wheel which was introduced in early history. The film also describes how knowledge is passed on either orally, in writing or in print.

results.title: Our golden heritage
results.creator_credit: Australian Dairy Board and Film Partnership (Vic.)
results.brief_description: Traces the early methods of making butter, capturing something of the simplicity of Australia’s early history. From here the scene moves to the modern interior of a dairy factory showing buttermakers and packers at work. To conclude, some examples of the ways butter can be used in cooking are shown.

results.title: Our feathered friends
results.creator_credit: Goopal Datt, Ezra Mir and Films Division, Government of India
results.brief_description: Fascinating birds abound in India. On the water there are storks, spoonbills, ibis, pelicans which are varied as to color, size and the shape of their beaks. Quiet except during the breeding season in contrast to others which chatter constantly, such as seagulls migrating from Europe. The monsoon heralds the mating season, when storks choose partners, court each other with dances and build nests for their young in trees or on the water in the reeds or on mounds, like the flamingoes, whose chicks change color as they grow up far from human habitation.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Goopal Datt, Ezra Mir and Films Division, Government of India

results.title: Our Earth
results.brief_description: A study of the physical properties of the earth in relation to population density and industries. Beginning with oceans and ocean currents and their effects on climate, and consequently on people, the film goes on to show analogous effects of various types of coastline and harbours, lakes, valleys, plateaus, plains and mountains.

results.title: Our daily bread [B&W]
results.creator_credit: Dennis Hill Productions, Peter Whitchurch, Kinelab and Peter Whitchurch Productions
results.brief_description: Opens with a brief historical survey of the origin of bread. Shows the processes involved in modern bread-making; growing of wheat, harvesting, shipping, storing, milling and baking, and explains the function of yeast in bread-making. The film also surveys the work of the Bread Research Laboratory in Sydney, established to improve efficiency and product standards.
